item.title: Report I-2024080006
item.description:
Report I-2024080006

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-19T21:12:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-08
  • City: BERLIN
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LPG LOGISTICS LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: July 8, 2024: On this date a driver for LPG Logistics USDOT 3142354 (C Three Logistics USDOT 2961868) was delivering the above listed material to a client in Berlin NJ. The Driver and receiver's operator failed to ensure the hose was empty of product prior to disconnecting the hose. The material within the hose ( Approx 5-20 gallons) spilled on the ground. The area was immediately secured. The product was contained with dry absorbent and absorbing pads and properly disposed of via an authorized recovery company. The report is being submitted at the request of the manufacturer/shipper. No injuries, deaths, fire, waterway involvement. NRC notified on 7-9-24 NRC # 1404204. NJDEP 24-07-09-1610-25 (Closed)

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box was discovered with signs of a release during sort operations at the MEMH location. The fiberboard box contained two plastic bottles packaged with styrofoam peanuts. One bottle had a loose cap causint the release of contents. All contents of the shipment were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report E-2024070291
item.description:
Report E-2024070291

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-14T15:13:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-10
  • City: MANVILLE
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 2000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 7/10/2024 at 09:45 hours, DOT Inspector Alan Fisher was conducting an inspection at the CSX Manville Yard in Manville, NJ. Mr. Fisher reported a suspect release from the top of NATX301283, a loaded tank car of Acetone. CSX isolated the car and notified the shipper, Sabic Innovative Plastics, via CHEMTREC (Report #2024-0710-00165). Marion Environmental Inc. (MEI), a CSX emergency response contractor, responded to inspect the car. MEI personnel verified a release of product vapor due to a blind flange on the pressure plate have no gasket installed. Contractor personnel installed a gasket between blind flange and pressure plate; secured the nuts to stop the release. The condition found and corrective measure were communicated to the shipper’s representative (Skyler Davis, 812-781-4454). Following the emergency repairs outlined, the car was held pending bubble leak test by a certified mobile repair unit.
